code: @Manual{,   title = {codename: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else},   author = {Steve Miller},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.4.9},   url = {https://github.com/svmiller/codename}, }

what: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: codename allows users create short, pithy code names organizations, work projects, , people, whatever else. core package eponymous codename() function, allows user create various types code names. code names returned function, large, two-word character vector attribute object. Right now, options include “” (default incorporates battery adjectives nouns), “gods” (object name deity saint religion), “ubuntu” (code name alliterative object always animal), “wu-tang” (code name derived classic Wu-Tang Name Generator). codename() also features ability use reproducible seeds, including character seeds, maximum transparency reproducibility.

title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: ideally soon able install CRAN, follows: , can install development version package devtools package.

title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: isn’t much belabor usage self-explanatory. sample output.
code: library(codename)  # Generate console message about package version. # Successive updates may break the expected output of a reproducible seed. # This just adds some layer of transparency/clarity. codename_message() #> code name generated by {codename} v.0.4.0  # defaults to any codename() #> [1] "moss green implication" codename() #> [1] "lavender blue snuggle" codename() #> [1] "warm purple ale" codename() #> [1] "pinkish train" codename(seed = 8675309) #> [1] "yellow orange twist" codename(seed = "My Project Name: The Subtitle of It Too") #> [1] "bright blue barbiturate"  codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "apricot juras mate" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "lighter green mokosh" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "untried chernobog" codename(type = "gods", seed = 8675309) #> [1] "scholarly wakan tanka"  codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "cuddly cricket" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "capital cod" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "joint jaguar" codename(type = "ubuntu", seed = 8675309) #> [1] "moss mandrill" codename(type = "ubuntu", seed = "My Ubuntu Release") #> [1] "toupe tahr"  codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Shriekin’ Wanderer" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Bittah Knight" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Zexy Dreamer" codename(type = "wu-tang", seed = "Steven V. Miller") #> [1] "X-cessive Observer"  variety_pack(seed = "A Reproducible Character Seed") #> [1] "afraid patriarch" #> [1] "meaty ausrine" #> [1] "banana barnacle" #> [1] "Scratchin’ Commander"

what: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: x character vector

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: char2seed() takes character vector returns reproducible seed use whatever purpose. used internally codename(). char2seed_v1() , using older method v. 0.1.0 v. 0.2.0 release.

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: Interested users can see works. Namely, letters (numbers) character vector assigned corresponding numbers. char2seed(), numbers concatenated together divided 1 minus absolute maximum number R can handle default (2^32). remainder division ultimately becomes reproducible seed. char2seed_v1(), numbers added together exponentiated create really big number. number divided 1 minus absolute maximum number R can handle default (2^32). remainder division ultimately becomes reproducible seed. nature parlor trick means possibility, however small, two different character vectors can return reproducible seed. happened https://github.com/svmiller/codename/issues/1, changed function generating seed moved old function char2seed_v1(). function may warn "loss accuracy", just means supplied really long character vector.

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: Steven V. Miller

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
code: char2seed("ABCDEF") #> [1] 123456 char2seed("Go Bucks!") #> [1] 655170768 char2seed("My Project Title") #> [1] 518381568

title: Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename
code: codename() #> [1] "forthright donut" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "glorious guanaco" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "light blue bangu mate" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Drunken Mastermind" codename(seed = 8675309) #> [1] "yellow orange twist" codename(seed = 8675309) #> [1] "yellow orange twist" codename(seed = "a character") #> [1] "dark sage kannon" codename(seed = "a character") #> [1] "dark sage kannon"

title: codename 0.5.0
text: codename_message() now display version R user well. add greater transparency event R changes seed generator .

title: codename 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-07 Ensure adjectives starting capital letters can matched animal names. Thank @lemna pointing fixing . Add adjectives animals starting x (HT: @lemna).

title: codename 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-24 Change char2seed() function move old version char2seed_v1(). affect codename(), beyond seed supplied output.

title: codename 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-10 Add codename_message() display package version console. may matter future updates alter underlying data, can change output reproducible seed. Add variety_pack() function sampling wares, (optional) reproducible seed. Remove “list” animals. function copy-pasting list found somewhere, just copy-pasted scraped without lot inspection output. Fix “chantio” “chantico” gods. bad. Scrub documentation instances “codename” “code name.” former works well function package name, “code name” proper English. don’t think anyone notice care. Force “” options lowercase. Basically, inclusion Wu-Tang names results mismatch. codename permit title case Wu-Tang name generator component package. Add set.seed(NULL) top line codename(). Basically, R’s set.seed() designed top-level script. means run seed , path pre-determined afterward code name generation follows path. Configure website pkgdown.

title: codename 0.1.0
